channel.title: Java and Macros
channel.description:
where can i learn to use Java with creating Macros?
I'm aware of the import java.awt.robot which allows for functionality of mouseMacroing.
but where do you learn on stuff like screen objects and in client objects? useful stuff Thanks.

item.title: Java and Macros
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

He’s talking about client objects… exactly what it sounds like. It’s just not about private servers

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

Ok, then I’m confused. Although he doesn’t clearly state it’s RSPS related, he is talking about “client objects”. OP mind explaining what you mean with that?

@davidi2 wrote:

Nope, it’s not RSPS related. It belongs here

item.title: Java and Macros
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:10, topic:471423”][quote author=Yesteryear link=topic=588957.msg4175021#msg4175021 date=1354891934]
Mouse macros in RSPS’s shouldn’t be the real mouse cursor, but just a clone (As java.awt.Robot uses the real cursor). This clone is basically just two numbers holding x and y coordinates on the screen, which you can set to emulate a mouse cursor.

To know the location of actual game objects on the screen I suggest you do some research in the client. You can’t just make a mouse macro without actually knowing the client.

Wrong section btw :|.
[/quote]

What section would it go in then…?[/quote]
Uh? Some RSPS related maybe?

Read full topic

To know the location of actual game objects on the screen I suggest you do some research in the client. You can’t just make a mouse macro without actually knowing the client.

item.title: Java and Macros
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

Mouse macros in RSPS’s shouldn’t be the real mouse cursor, but just a clone (As java.awt.Robot uses the real cursor). This clone is basically just two numbers holding x and y coordinates on the screen, which you can set to emulate a mouse cursor.

To know the location of actual game objects on the screen I suggest you do some research in the client. You can’t just make a mouse macro without actually knowing the client.

Wrong section btw :|.

Read full topic

item.title: Java and Macros
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:2, topic:471423”]You would have to be decent at reverse engineering.[/quote]This. Please ignore Uncalled and imthenull

You need to understand how the client works to be able to use the information it gives you. Unless you plan on using some sort of screen reader, which really shouldn’t be written in Java. The Robot class can hardly do anything when it comes to getting you the information you need like “screen objects and in client objects”, so that’s where the reverse engineering comes in.

Read full topic

@op what does the robot class not have that you would need?
